name: woli-webgui
description: WoLi-webgui is a self-hosted web interface for managing Wake-on-LAN actions. It lets you add devices, trigger wake requests, and organize targets into a convenient dashboard for remote power control at home or in small offices.
features: Device management: Store MAC addresses and device names for quick access to your network machines.
Wake-on-LAN packets: Send magic packets to wake devices remotely from anywhere on your network.
Dashboard view: See all registered devices in a clean interface with status indicators.
Grouping: Organize devices into groups like servers, workstations, or media centers for easier management.
Quick wake: One-click wake buttons for each device eliminate the need for command-line tools.
Status checking: Ping devices to verify if they're online before attempting to wake them.
Scheduled wake: Set up automated wake schedules for devices that need regular power-on times.
Mobile access: Manage and wake devices from smartphones or tablets via responsive web UI.
Multi-subnet support: Wake devices across different network segments with proper routing configuration.
Authentication: Protect the interface with password authentication to prevent unauthorized wake requests.
Wake history: View logs of wake attempts and their timestamps for troubleshooting.
Broadcast configuration: Configure broadcast addresses for networks with specific routing requirements.
